benchmark_config.jira_title: Implement/Test API: PUT /1.0/kb/accounts/{childAccountId}/transferCredit - Move a given child credit to the parent level

covered: Valid PUT request and successful transfer behavior: response 204 and correct parent/child balance updates (TC01).
Optional headers handled: X-Killbill-Reason and X-Killbill-Comment accepted and recorded in audit logs (TC02).
Required header validation and missing-header error handling (TC06).
Path parameter validation (UUID format) and malformed-ID handling (TC07).
Error handling for no-child-credit (400) and non-existent child or parent accounts (404) (TC03, TC04, TC05, TC12).
Extra/unsupported headers ignored without affecting operation (TC08).
Service unavailability / network failure scenario covered (TC09).
Security input validation for header injection and unexpected header formats (TC11, TC15).
Concurrency and race conditions coverage: concurrent transfer and double-transfer regression (TC14, TC16).
Performance under large dataset conditions (basic response-time threshold) (TC13).
API backward compatibility with older client versions (TC17).
gaps: No assertions for response headers / Content-Type (application/json) and 204 empty-body semantics—tests do not verify Content-Type, Content-Length or that success responses are correctly empty.
No tests for sending an unexpected request body (API declares "Request Body: N/A") to verify whether payloads are rejected or ignored.
No server-side internal error (500) or simulated DB-failure tests to validate safe failure modes and absence of partial state changes.
Rate limiting / throttling behavior (e.g., 429 responses) is not covered.
Numeric edge cases are missing: very large credit values, potential overflow, negative balances, or precision issues are not tested.

Audit log verification is partial: tests check reason/comment but do not assert X-Killbill-CreatedBy is recorded, nor do they verify log entries include amounts, pre/post balances, timestamps, or transaction IDs.
Role-based / fine-grained authorization checks are not present (only generic unauthenticated/unauthorized scenarios).
Idempotency and replay semantics beyond simple double-call are not covered (e.g., retries, deduplication, idempotency keys).
Transactional atomicity and rollback on mid-transfer failures are not explicitly tested (no scenario that forces parent-update failure and verifies child state).
Parent-account state edge cases are missing: inactive/closed/blocked parent, self-parent or cyclical parent-child references are not tested.
No explicit tests asserting error response schema and that error payloads are consistent JSON (code/message/fields).
Observability/telemetry checks (request IDs, audit trail accessibility, log formatting) are not covered.
recommendations: Add assertions for response headers: verify Content-Type is application/json for error responses and confirm 204 responses have appropriate empty-body semantics (Content-Length or no body).
Add a negative test that sends a JSON payload/body with the PUT request and assert the API rejects it (400) or explicitly documents the behavior (ignored vs. error).
Simulate server / DB failures to validate 500 responses and ensure no partial transfers occur; verify DB state after induced failures to confirm rollback.
Introduce rate-limiting tests (bursts/concurrent requests) and assert expected throttling behavior (429 or documented policy).
Add boundary tests for credit amounts: very large values, negative values, and precision/rounding checks to detect overflow or numeric handling bugs.
Enhance audit/log verification: assert X-Killbill-CreatedBy is recorded and logs contain transfer amount, pre/post balances, timestamp and transaction id for traceability.
Add role-based authorization tests (different user roles/scopes) to ensure correct 403 behaviour for insufficient privileges.
Add idempotency/replay tests: repeated/replayed requests, idempotency-key handling or deduplication behavior for safe retries.
Create transactional atomicity tests that force a failure during parent update (e.g., simulate parent DB failure) and confirm the child account state is unchanged (rollback).
Add tests for parent-account edge cases (inactive/closed/blocked parent, parent==child, cyclical relationships) to define and validate correct error handling.
Validate error response schema (consistent JSON fields: error code, message, field) for all error cases to ensure clients can reliably parse errors.
Include observability tests: presence of request-id headers (or equivalent), audit trail retrieval, and that logs contain sufficient metadata for debugging.
